alert.note: Alert for Covington; Forrest; Jefferson Davis; Jones; Lamar; Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 17 at 8:30PM CDT until April 17 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Jefferson Davis County in south central Mississippi... Northeastern Marion County in south central Mississippi... Southern Covington County in southeastern Mississippi... Northern Forrest County in southeastern Mississippi... Southern Jones County in southeastern Mississippi... Northern Lamar County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 830 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in portions of the area. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hattiesburg, Petal, West Hattiesburg, Sumrall, Prentiss, Sanford, Melba, Rawls Springs, Oak Grove, Improve, Eastabuchie, Moselle, Bunker Hill, Carson, Lone Star, Sunrise, Macedonia, Society Hill, Goss and Progress. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Covington; Forrest; Jefferson Davis; Jones; Lamar; Marion
